text: Not at all a good place to eat for Vegetable Manchurian and Pani Puri both were not at all good and expensive. Pani Puri they just gave potato pieces boiled and put in the puri with no salt, no pepper,no chick peas...I would suggest not to go to this place for eating chat.

This place sucks don't recomend it the food is ok it took an hour to get us water the service is really bad the boss is not nice he doesn't care about us and he wouldn't give us a table even though their were 6 open he kept saying it's very buizzy even though their was like 2 people their this place really suck plz dont come here and waste your money.

Please do not order any north indian food out here. Its terrible. yellow sauce aka curry with chicken/paneer thrown in.

But South Indian food is excellent. Very well done Udupi.
Six of us for dinner - adults and teens - fabulous food - we'll definitely be back. Vegan & vegetarian dishes so tasty. And very reasonably priced.

As a vegetarian, it is sometimes hard to find delicious and flavorful food when going out. Udupi's vegetarian lunch buffet is AM-AZ-ING. I have yet to try anything there that I didn't like, and I am a very picky eater. I've never been for dinner, but I have done the lunch buffet many times now. They always have new dishes to try and everything always tastes incredible. The staff is always attentive, and even suggested a spicy soup to clear up my cold one day. Even my boyfriend, who is a serious meat eater, bugs me to go there all the time. I will definitely go there whenever in the mood for some great Indian food.

One of the best vegan/vegetarian restaurants accessible to people near Tempe and Scottsdale. If stopping by during lunch buffet, visit on the weekend because they generally have at least one extra dish available.
We love this place. This is the only indian restaurant in town that we highly recomend, they have great service, and amazing food

Being south indian myself, i really really want to see south indian restaurants  succeed in the valley, and being a life long vegetarian I really want to see such restaurants continue.  This was my first time at Udupi, and can honestly say I went in with high expectations, and left wanting never to go back. 

We got there at 2:40 and I asked the host, if it was too late to enjoy the buffet and if we should order from the menu or take the buffet- he insisted the buffet would be wonderful.  I mentioned that this was our first time here and asked if there was anything special we should try.  he said the buffet is wonderful and that while they close the buffet at 3, we should feel free to enjoy our lunch after.  Everything looked appetizing so we loaded our plates and sat down. The waiter brought out two dosa's for us and everything had the makings of a good lunch.
BIG problem 1:
Sadly, the food was cold, even the dosa they supposedly freshly made was cold- not just the crepe on the outside, which would naturally cool quickly, but the filling inside as well.  I mentioned the cold food to the waiter and he actually GRINNED and walked away.  Maybe he didn't hear me?  who knows.

Big Problem 2:
Our host didn't tell us that it wasn't just the buffet that closed at 3, but the restaurant itself. Our waiter actually changed his clothes and left without even telling us!! I looked around for him, and the host came over and asked us "what are you searching for?" and i mentioned our waiter and he goes "oh he went home, we are closed right now, we are all just waiting for you so we can also go" so of course, we dropped our forks mid-bite got up and left- $13 per person!! when i mentioned the cold food, the host said that the food is cold because they turned off their food warmers over half an hour ago (um, thanks for the heads up)

You know, i could forgive the gaps in service if the food was stellar.  but it was eh, with the exception of the spinach kootu dish with was delicious.   I went up to the condiment bar and when i moved a ladle a bunch of fruit flies came out of the salad area- yuck. 

WHY would anyone with any amount of self-respect serve a guest food they new was cold/sub par and then hurry them out of there.  If he had just said- hey we close completely in 20 mins, please join us for dinner I absolutely would have come back.  Greedy Greedy Greedy. 

I sincerely hope my experience is an isolated incident, but I'll never go back, not will i ever suggest them to anyone.

Really excellent Indian food, with full flavor and large portions. Certainly the best Indian restaurant in the Valley, and all the more special because of the focus on Southern Indian cuisine. The interior has really fantastic large format photographs that will immediately cheer you up. Everything we have ever eaten at Udupi has been delicious.

Great food! As close to South Indian as you will get here in AZ. The owner is fantastic and his staff is friendly and efficient. The buffet changes regularly and everything is always fresh and tasty. And all the dosas you can eat!!!
This is incredible food for the absolute pickiest eaters! Sunday buffet gives you an excellent sampling of the best in vegan/vegetarian food. As good as homemade!!! Friendly staff and great service

We initially ordered masala dosai, medhu vada and idly. The sambhar in these dishes was ok; chutney was good. Medhu vada and dosai came out really well but idly was not liked by my partner. My partner and I are Indian and she felt she could make much better ones with lot less rawa than that was used in udupi's idly. Here came the bad part midway through our dinner-- seems their coffee filter machine was broken the time we visited them. But that did not stop the waiter / manager-looking guy with a beard from taking the second leg of our order for a mysore "filter" coffee ( as advertised). Well, right after that I had the need to confirm if they were gonna give me a coffee in traditional mysore/south karnataka style. Halfway through my enquiry, the same guy interrupts me rather rudely (his exactly reply in the form of a question was "what do you mean by traditional?"), later explaining that the filter coffee  cant be made in traditional  style cause their coffee filter machine was broken and hey! he was not sorry about it. Not sorry for almost selling me a different product than i asked for and not sorry for interrupting me! I am not sure if he thought I was making a very special accommodation request when i ordered something from the menu. If he thought so, he would be very wrong about it. Consequently, he lost the business he could have had with us for the rest of the evening. We were going to order much more before this guy spoilt our dinner atmosphere-- our bill could have easily been double and we would have also left the place with twice the satisfaction (and twice the number of stars for them).

Not all service was bad-- there was a girl who waited on us properly and took our initial orders of masala dosai, idly and medhu vada. We left a reasonable tip and we dearly hope all of it reaches the girl.

Udupi is a delicious vegetarian restaurant on the Tempe/Scottsdale line.  It is primarily vegetarian, and also has some vegan offerings.  It has a daily lunch buffet, a good value at $9 on weekdays, that goes up Friday-Sunday.

Being a budget hunter foodie, the lunch buffet fits the bill. The freshly cooked dosa makes a welcome appetizer and I eat it with the coconut and tomato chutneys, both delicious.  Two soups are also available, one a tomatoey lentil soup, quite savoury, and the other is a sour vegetarian soup that has a pleasant tang to it.

The lentil cakes are delicious and, again, go well with the aforementioned chutneys.  After finishing one or two of them I move onto the rice and curries.  I love them all including the matter paneer (peas with cheese cubes), split yellow lentil curry, green bean and coconut curry, and the cauliflower and potatoes.

The buffet also includes dessert, usually something sweet yet healthy, such as the carrot halwa.  You won't be disappointed with the lunchtime buffet.

I've also eaten here a couple times at night.  I love the Gobi Manchuria, so much so that it's what I ate both times.  It tastes like a vegetarian Orange Chicken--a dish that will satisfy even the meat eaters amongst us.  

Check out this place, support a local business, and enjoy a delicious meal and good service.

I LOVE Udupi!  In fact, since the first time my wife and I ate at Udupi, sambar has become a regular part of our breakfast rotation. We've ordered so many different south Indian spices, dals, curry leaves, and cooking supplies (tawa, electric stone grinder for dosa batter, idli steamer etc) that Amazon seems to think we live in India, which is awesome, as we just keep finding more stuff to try.  Udupi has opened up a whole new cuisine to us, and we can't get enough of it!  

Don't think of Udupi as a vegetarian restaurant.  Yes, the food is strict vegetarian, but that is the way south Indian food is prepared.  Since most veg restaurants aren't very good, if you think about Udupi this way, you'll miss out trying this cuisine, which is truly sad.  

To the Udupi staff - keep doing what you do!  It was a complete fluke that we found you... we were looking for another veg restaurant up the street, which happened to be closed and we stumbled in.  Now south Indian food is a big part of our lives.  BTW - we've been chasing the perfect home-made dosa for a long time, and can't seem to master the art (but getting better.)  If you want two sous chefs to work for free on the weekends in exchange for some dosa tips, we're totally up for it!

Best Indian food ever!!!  I lived in NYC for a while and couldn't find anything quite as good as Udupi.  Great prices (hubby and I can get out of there for under $20 bill).  The Aloo Gobi is perfect and I love their assorted appetizer platter.  Fried goodness!  The staff is very friendly.  I've done the lunch buffet, too, which is fun and great for mixing it up if you find yourself ordering the same thing every time.  Only $8.95!  Took a group of work friends (even some hardcore meat eaters) and everyone left happy and full.

wicked tasty.  friendly service.
i really appreciate knowing that there is ABSOLUTELY ZERO chance of finding meat in my food, as this is a fully vegetarian restaurant.  some stuff does have dairy in it, but the menu is full of vegan dishes and makes it pretty clear.
the chana batura is my current favorite, chick peas and giant puffy bread!

I have been to a few Indian restaurants in the area, and have been at least mildly disappointed with them(dirty, bad food, poor service etc). This was my first visit to Udupi, which I have been wanting to try for some time since I am interested in vegetarian and ethnic food. I initially drove right past the place since it's easier to see the sign going south than north. The dining room was clean, well lit, and smelled nice. The waitress(who was very nice and understanding that I didn't want to butcher the food names) talked me into the fresh lemon drink(like a bubbly lemonade) which was really good. I ended up getting the Medhu Vada (lentil donuts) and the Palak Paneer (Spinich with soft cheese cubes). It came with basmati rice and some sort of cream sauce on the side. The donuts are dense, so I'd advise on not slamming them like I did. The palak paneer was wonderful. Great portion size and plenty of paneer cubes(I once when to an Indian place that had maybe 4-5 small cubes in the whole dish). I wanted to get dessert (even though I was so full), but other people in my party weren't interested(Full too!). 
          The one thing I didn't like about the place was the menu. I am not that familiar with Indian food, but I am very open minded about trying new things. The menu assumes you know what foreign words mean and what to expect from the dish. I would put a glossary in the back and maybe some pictures.
           In closing, I would definitely go back and would recommend this place to everyone interested in Indian food, including vegetarians.

This used to be my favorite Indian restaurant. My sweetie and I would go sometimes as often as once a week (once we hit them three times in seven days). We've tried a sizesble portion of the menu and have loved all of it. I do food somewhat spicy, he does food spicier than I (but not Thai hot), and their food fit the bill perfectly for spice level. The staff were friendly, water glasses kept full. Excellent.

Two weeks ago, I went with my young son and ordered muter paneer bland for him and vegetable manchurian for myself -- two of my favorites.

Both dishes were hotter than anything I've ever eaten there. My son just ate plain rice. My stomach burned for a couple of hours. The waitstaff didn't come over to check on us. When we were finally able to flag her down, she apologized, comped his meal, asked if he wanted something else (no).

Went tonight with my beau. Got those same two dishes, and again, they were painfully hot. Noses running, eyes watering, not at all enjoyable. Definitely not eating the leftovers for lunch (as per our usual plan). Mr. I Like It Spicy agreed that the food was uncomfortably hot.

Again, no attention to the table between food being dropped off and the check being tossed onto the table.

The difference was stark enough that I wonder if they changed hands, or if a new person is making decisions, because it ain't the old Udupi, for sure.

Maybe it'll change back, but I won't be there to find out.
I love this place i been to this place many times and i love the food. People here are courteous. I would recommend this place for good Indian vegetarian food.

One of the best vegetarian food restaurants in the Phoenix Metro area. Udupi has been a staple of me and my family for over 5 years now. The lunch buffet is always well stocked with a variety of rotating menu items and the full menu fare is likewise excellent and reasonably priced.

Outstanding food and sevice! We tried multiple entrees and every single one has been excellent. For legit and truly authentic Indian food this is a must try. Great prices and you won't be disappointed. Super friendly and helpful staff.

Amazing! I was blown away at the variety of perfectly-dialed flavors, especially in the sauces and chutneys. My friend doesn't like Indian food & LOVED it. The Gobi Manchurian (cauliflower that puts buffalo wings to shame) is a must. My other favorite are the Dosai's, I've had a few types (spinach, potato & Mysore hot chutney which you should try on the side, it's a very intense slow building sweat but incredible) they're all tasty and come with delicious Sambar lentil soup. I recommend the Assorted Appetizer just for the sauces (pickled chili chutney, tamarind sauce, coconut chutney). I could eat this for every meal, it's literally bliss food! I haven't done the buffet but my brother said it's a trade off, can't take home leftovers but more variety to try. I was surprised most of the dishes have no animal products. More oily and salty than I like to eat but worth it.

Went here for lunch.  It was a good place, but there is no meat, so if that what you are looking for, you should go elsewhere.  I gave it an A-OK.  Wasn't my favorite place, but it wasn't bad.  Lots of spicy food, so be careful.  I'm sure I will be feeling it later tonight.  The help was very attentive and they continued to fill your water glass.  Which is great, because my mouth is still a little bit on fire.

Udupi Cafe is my new favorite Indian restaurant in Phoenix. Wonderful spices, intense flavor spectrum, and genuine homemade flavor will satisfy any eater, carnivore or vegan. 

I dined with a group of friends late on a Friday evening. Opting for adventure, most of us ordered blindly from the extensive - all vegetarian - menu, selecting whatever "sounded good". There are tons of vegan options as well. 

I ordered Palek Paneer (my Indian food barometer). It was spicy, fresh, and filled with cubes of paneer.  The house specialty Vegetable Manchurian are meatball-sized chunks of crispy deliciousness dripping with sweet chili sauce. They reminded me of a spicy crispy honey chicken, but vegan! The dosai (crepes) my friends ordered were huge flavorful pockets filled with spicy veggies. The light pillows of paratha (bread) reminded me of sopapillas. Chili Pakora appetizers were insanely delicious, an Indian pepper popper, & a definite "gotta try it" for any fan of spicy. 

Fantastic service. Water glasses were kept full. Waiters were attentive, and the food was served piping hot and quickly, even for our large party.

I will definitely return to satisfy my new craving for Palek Paneer & Vegetable Manchurian, and to try something new.

I haven't tried many items or the lunch buffet yet, but from whatever I've had here, I would say its a decent option for Indian food. Being a vegetarian, its a nice thing to know that there is no chance of meat ending up in my food.

The food is really really bad. Even the taste of food is no where close to even the worst street vendor in India. Friends if you want to torture someone please take that person to this place. This place won't let you down in that sense. 
The dishes were limited, the price is high. It was a big mistake that i went there but I request you not to do the same and save your money and time

What happened to Udupi???  I used to eat here all the time, at least twice per month. I wasn't able to go for at least two years due to health reasons. I went twice in the last month all excited at the prospect of good Indian food and found the variety and taste very mediocre at the buffet. We asked the man at the counter as we were leaving if there were new owners and he said no there wasn't but there was a new chef (I'm sure they change chefs a lot more often than that!). We told him the food was not like it used to be and that the variety of the buffet had not changed between the two times we had been in the last month. Very disappointed and probably won't be back anytime soon.The place has sure changed from what it used to be.
Spectacular service and nice waiters. The food was great and I got the peas paratha and the gobi manchurian. The restaurant was spick and span. Great environment and nice pictures on the wall.

So here's the deal... I love Indian food. I grew up with easy access to some great examples of it growing up (partly due to my friends' parents). But since moving to Arizona a few years back, it's been difficult finding good places for some Indian cuisine.

A few months back, I was driving down Scottsdale Road and a sign caught my eye... 100% vegetarian. I later discovered that it was an Indian restaurant that was held in pretty high regard from a few of my friends and I knew that I had to give it go... I've now been to Udupi Cafe for lunch a few times. Pretty much the only thing that I would change would be it's location to Central Phoenix so I could eat there more often!

Udupi's lunch buffet is awesome (especially for less than $10)! It has a good selection of flavorful dishes (most of which are actually vegan). The usual favorites are in attendance (a variety of chutneys, dhal, paratha, etc.) as well as a few dishes that are a little more particular to Udupi (the lemon rice is great).

In addition to the selections at the buffet, you are also served an amazing curried potato-filled dosa with your meal. For those of you unfamiliar with dosai, they are the Indian equivalent of a French crepe that's made from rice (not that I'm one of them, but they're also great for people that are trying to be gluten-free). The filling aside (which is tasty though nothing super special), the actual dosa crepe at Udupi is one the best that I've ever had in Phoenix or elsewhere! Awesome texture and flavor!!!

Although I can only comment on their lunch buffet, I would imagine that the rest of their food would only be better. Bottom line: a great place for Indian food in the Phoenix-metro area (the best that I've had so far)!

A step above the usual Indian buffet places. 

This vegetarian place has great options as well as a friendly staff. We went for buffet on Sunday. They had good options including vada, upma, gobi manchurian.

Ok this place is a solid 3 stars but not quite 4. I want to come back and order off the menu and try something made to order.  I tried the lunch buffet and it was pretty good. The wait staff was über attentive and checked in with me throughout my meal. Even after I paid, the wait staff checked in on me. The highlights for me were the spicy mushrooms and the coconut chutney. They have a chutney bar, which I truly appreciate. The freshly made dosa (for every diner) was a nice touch. I look forward to my next visit to hopefully give another star.

Definitely not worth the price for this buffet. Don't have a wide spread, hence for the $13 price it's just not satisfying. 
The food  is okay ish. This being a South Indian place, the dosa and idli were good. But the roti sabzi is just fine. Also the rice included in the  buffet did not taste fresh, seemed like heated up last night's rice. 
So yeah they should definitely notch up for the price they charge.
Fantastic food, I'm so glad they have reopened! I can't stand anywhere else in town, so flavorful, just the right temperature, so fresh and tasty!

The fact that their coffee drink "with cream" and their tea with milk are labeled as vegan make me wonder if they really know what vegan means or if their "vegan" dishes also have ghee or some other dairy in them. 

My main complaint is the service. When we asked our server what he recommended as far as vegan food, he replied that he didn't know because he hadn't eaten there in three months....and then he recommended a dish with cottage cheese in it.    In addition, he told us it's BYOB and that we could bring wine because they probably have a corkscrew. He saw one in the kitchen three months ago...uh ok. Later we were asked if we needed anything "since you're the only two people here." He was definitely trying, so that's something I guess. 

The food was spicy, but pretty good overall. The servings are large (2-3 meals worth, for me).  My vegan dish was served with a yogurt sauce (not vegan). My husband had the fried cauliflower dish and liked it enough but doesn't have any desire to return. 

It might be better to go to the lunch buffet so you can figure out what you like. There are minimal descriptions on the menu and the servers (since the first hadn't eaten there he called over a second server) were unable to answer questions such as "what does this word mean?", "is this deep fried?", "is this spicy?", etc.

We might give it another chance and try the lunch buffet, since it's so close to our place. Probably not though.

I had lunch here just last week and I forgot to post my review. So, I was really surprised at how delicious everything was. I'm a vegetarian and find it difficult to find eating places that have more than one item for me to choose from. The waitstaff was very pleasant and helpful- very courteous. The best dish was the okra, not sure the name of it, but it was awesome! Pricing for the buffet is reasonable and I will definitely return, and bring more people with me!

Really, really good food. Seriously my FAV Indian food restaurant in the states. Very friendly staff and you can get the buffet 'to go' if you prefer. Love that you don't need to worry about meat contamination in the kitchen as its all vegetarian and vegan.
One of my favorite places  to get Indian food. I'm vegan so I love that there is so much  to choose from. My all time favorite is the chili gobi and vegetable manchurian. I'm so glad Udupi reopened.

This is my favorite place to get Indian food for dinner. I could say that I've tried many things, but that was a long time ago - now my friends and I just order Chili gobi (breaded cauliflower in a spicy tomato sauce), Chana Batura (chickpeas with a huge piece of puffy bread), and usually the Aloo gobi (potatoes and cauliflower in a yellow curry sauce). 

You will not miss the meat dishes - I mean it.

I have also been to the buffet here many times and it is not my favorite indian buffet. I find that the food buffet items can be hit-or-miss. Go for dinner and you will NOT be disappointed!

I'm always on the lookout for new flavors to treat my palette. Indian cuisine has a wonderful variety of herbs and spices to sample.
I stumbled on this jewel late at night when everything else had already closed.  To my delight they have many vegetarian and vegan items on the menu. I tried an eggplant with curry dish. The dish had many layers of flavor and prepared to perfection. 
I highly recommend taking the path less traveled by and expanding your taste bud's horizon.

We love this place and visit often. Great buffets weekends and weekdays (weekend has a bit more options). Everything is vegetarian and they recently started labeling which items are vegan too. That's great for vegans like us (we used to have to ask about many items). Buffet selection varies week by week--always good! Great value too.

I am obsessed with this place whether I go in for the lunch buffet or have delivery. The amount of vegan options are amazing and I have never had a bad meal. I am about to move a mile away and they will probably be seeing me at least once a week from now on.
Open again!!! Really missed while it was closed the last few months. One of my favorite places. Great lunch buffet for vegans.
Thank you, Udupi, for being here and instantly transporting me back home to Madurai every time I visit. You are the best.

Such a cute, little restaurant! I have to give it 5 stars for the excellent customer service. Our staff was so friendly and helpful,  and extremely polite. The food was great, too! I loved the naan at this place and enjoyed my chai tea.  The tiki masala was wonderful  even as a leftover the next day. And, yes there was plenty enough for leftovers. We also had for dessert (rice pudding) which I recommend.  So sweet and satisfying! I look forward to going back again!  
PS don't doubt vegan, it can and will fill you up. ..especially at this place:-)

You understand every word in the menu? I did not. The service has always been very helpful, they explained me everything. The food is straight forward good, the service is attentive and friendly. I love the "Uppma". Can't beat the price. Vegans, vegetarians, you've got to try that place!!

Great place to grab lunch on the weekend. The buffet has a lot of delicious vegetarian options, and it is priced very well. They also provide free dosas! If you end up getting dessert, get the rice pudding with some sweetened carrots.

In today's buffet, okra Masala has too much salt. It would be good if chef tastes after cooking.
Service was awesome and way of treating customer is really appreciated. But the core of restaurant is food.
Really great Indian food. I loved the spices they were bold and some spicy.  Vegetarian select was great.  Having traveled to Indian in the past this food was closely matched.

This was my third visit and it wasn't as impressive as the first time. Tonight (Saturday), there was only one server attending to a restaurant filled with customers. The term Udupi symbolizes authentic South Indian food. I ordered Masala Dosa and it was far from from its origin, and the iddli  was hard! Lassi on the other hand was the only thing I liked. The poor server was so busy running around that she even forgot our bill, and then when we waited for her at the counter, she calculated our total incorrectly! This dramatic change in their service is explained by change in management. No wonder! Anyways, I'm not sure if I'll be coming back.

Went for the buffet. the selection and quality was what you would expect when spending $10 on a buffet. Flavors were good, service was good, and the fact that there was no meat on the buffet was a plus.  I would recommend, and I plan to return.

Never disappointed 
Amazing food
This time ordered unconventional order but was great.
My seven year old who had parafait and orange juice at the zoo 15 min before coming ended up eating half Parantha and paneer.

Fresh vada absolutely great

Absolutely delicious, and vegetarian!  The spices and flavors and wonderful, and the menu offers a good variety.  Definitely recommend the buffet- larger and more interesting than most local Indian buffets- you will be satisfied!

Been here quite a few times but this time it seemed like a lot changed the food taste especially. Service was very good...but food didn't seemed to do justice to the name of the place! Papdi chat had very less papdi and was okay. Gobi manchurian(speciality earlier) was tasting oily...the Mysore masala dosa lacked the red chutney inside n overall taste but the spinach dosa was the saving grace!

I've been coming here since I was a student at asu I think it just gets better and better! I'm a vegetarian, so going to a restaurant with all vegetarian / vegan options is such a breath of fresh air. 

Please do not miss out on the Gobi Manchurian or the palak paneer... They are two of the best I've had hands down. I now bring my family here , 3 year old son included and the staff is always attentive, friendly and helpful in explaining the menu. The lunch buffet is incredible, it's always so fun to pick out something new and add it to our next order.

I will never know what the food tastes like because they were so so rude, I will not go back.  We came in and were given a table, menus were practically thrown at us.  And then we waited, and waited and waited.  We asked a woman working there, and she apparently did not speak English and indicated a man at the front would help us.  But he was too busy talking.  We got up and left.  No one even said a word when we left.

It's worst place to eat, day by day taste becoming worst . Especially  chutney , at least they should watch YouTube video and learn  how to make chutney. They spoiled name of "Udipi".they serve cold dosa's. I am wondering how people are giving 4 star, these guys doesn't deserve 1 star. They add raw milk on top of rasamali.Boild daal  I prepare at my home taste way better than these guys daal.
We tried out this place last weekend and we both hooked. They have quite a varieties of vegetarian dishes and also desserts. Don't forget to order dosa which is my favorite.
Good food, reasonable price,  friendly staff. Good service. Rava dosa excellent. Good  location

Yesterday I had ordered food for my daughter's birthday party from Udupi cafe. We had placed order two days in advance. Food ,as promised, was delivered exactly at the promised time. All food items like Panner Butter Masala, Aloo tikki, biryani were too delicious. All the guests really liked food taste and appreciated the same. 

At the end, no food was left which indirectly shows that they enjoyed food !!

Many thanks to Udupi management specially Gaurav, who gave us sufficient concession as well and delivered the food on time without compromising quality. 

Thank you Udupi cafe for making my daughter's birthday event memorable !!

One of best food I ever had. Simply amazing food.Staff is very friendly and they make food based on your requirements.
We tried paper masala dosa , chana batura as well as Saturday lunch everything was superb.

Gobi Manchurian was great. Masala Dosai was delicious. Friendly helpful waiter. We are newbies to Indian food and our waiter was very patient with us. We went for dinner, but will return soon for the lunch buffet. Highly recommend.

When I fly into or out of Sky Harbor, I never miss the opportunity to eat at Udupi's. Just ten minutes down the road from the airport, I always look forward to the scrumptious Indian food on tap here. 

I have no idea what anything is called, but they have these HUGE pancake-type things that are wrapped around this crazy-good potato stuff, and may daughters go crazy for them. I have to sneak a bite when they're getting something from the buffet. And speaking of the buffet, everything is vegetarian, with vegan offerings clearly marked (even the sauces/dressings). 

Be warned, some of the dishes are weld-level spicy, while others are very mild, and most things somewhere in between. My advice is: take a very small sampling of everything and go back for more of your favorites. Oh, and come hungry - there's no way you will have room for dessert.

This restaurant has the most extensive menu of vegan dishes that I have found anywhere. The cauliflower dish is particularly flavorful.

The location of this restaurant is its downfall. Because it is on an intersection with no traffic light, getting into the parking lot from the northbound lane requires a left turn into traffic. Likewise, exiting the parking lot to go north requires a left turn against lots of traffic. Furthermore, the parking lot itself is a problem, being cramped as all get out. Finally, the restaurant is next door to a dingy laundromat populated by some unsavory folk.

First full vegeterian.tried lunch buffet. Pongal was good. They made urad dhall bonda and said it as pakoda but anyways it tasted good. Rasam was not so good. Sambhar oki. Good number of curries. Dosa was perfect. Idli it was sour. Probably they should have made kaima idli with that. Sweets was good.nice place

We absolutely love every dish they have here! Some of our favorites, though, are gobi manchurian, dosa, and the chole bhaturi. We live in North Phoenix but travel there for their tasty buffet. The staff is always friendly and courteous. If you want to try great Indian food, come here!

Vegetarian South Indian Buffet...

I've been a fan of Indian food since my first taste of Aloo Gobi, and being a west-sider, I am very rarely in this part of town, however this little gem is worth the trip.

Being in the East Valley for a meeting with my vegetarian co-worker, we couldn't pass on trying out this place.  After one trip to the buffet, we were not only hooked, we were already full.  

I have  been to a lot of Indian buffets around town, and this one introduced me to a lot of new items, and tastes, I had never experienced before.  Being strictly vegetarian (and some vegan), you did not have all those "regular" dishes you find in the other buffets (tandori chicken, lamb curries..etc.), so they were replaced by new and exciting delicacies.

The mushoom tikka masala was so go, I could have pulled my chair up to the buffet and stayed for the day.  We were also introduced to Dosai, or rice crepes, this variety filled with potato and onion.  

If you happen to find yourself in this part of town, a visit here is something you will not regret.

OH...One last thing...

You know how they say that you can tell an ethnic restaurant is good if "they" eat there.  Well during my visit, ALL the other guests were Indian!    

'Nough said!

You gotta love this place for what it is.  Vegetarian/Vegan with tons of spices and flavor; yeah, you can tell the veggies are frozen sometimes or not the highest quality, but the flavors and great cooking make all the difference.  Beware the Sat Sun lunch buffets are a little more money.
Nothing exceptional about food, typical US-Indian taste. Nice ambiance.
To be frankly I didn't like the curries.. I didn't feel the spice level was as good as it should be.. I went there for lunch.. Good part is south Indian dishes.. But curries are not up to the mark..

I live close to this place. Used to come several times every week. Shared a dish with my husband and still very filling. Their owner changed about 2 month ago. Kitchen staff remain the same, 10 year old carpet is replaced with tile and the decor looks fresher.  I was and still am a fan of this place. Their authentic food deserve applause.

This place has a wide variety for vegetarians and vegas. The portions are large and the prices are reasonable. But the potato masala which is a key part of many dosas is disappointing. Too dry, bland and the potatoes are like a lump. Even the chutneys and sambar can be better.

I typically despise buffets because the quality of the food is inconsistent and sometimes questionable.  However, this place is amazing! The food was delicious and all of the dishes had a unique flavor.  Definitely will go there again!

I read the reviews here at yelp & agree with most of you... this is one of the best south indian restaurants outside India. The buffet is great, not greasy like a lot of other indian restaurants, typical taste of south india. I saw some reviews about the place being unhygeinic. It is as clean as it gets. It's possible it was not so clean earlier? 

The service was pretty decent, considering there was only one person serving! They could hire couple of waiters to make the service better. 

My family really enjoyed it. My son was apprehensive with it being completely vegetarian, but even he ate heartily. It was a nice mother's day buffet.

I love Indian cuisine and this place is awesome because everything is Vegan or Vegetarian. A friend and I walked in and ordered to go. It was pretty busy and the menu offered a wide variety. I didn't recognize the names of the dishes so the host helped to explain the dishes and that there were different regions of Indian cuisine. We ordered: 

*-Vegetable Samosas- mmmmmm so yummy, stuffed with potatoes, onions, and peas. I     liked it dunked in the yogurt sauce.
*-Poori- Indian bread, this was good with the chutney but it was a little crispy for me since I'm used to eating naan.
*-Mango Chutney- Sweet and spicy, huge chunks of mango.
*-Vegetable Curry- The flavor was perfect, spicy but not too spicy, lots of veggies.
*-Extra rice...

Overall, it was pretty good. I think that it was a little pricey for the amount of food you get. I would go back to try the lunch buffet since you get to try a variety of things for a better price.

Vegetarian/Vegan south Indian buffet!  Guilt free conscience! What more could a girl want? I am in LOVE with the dosas.  I always wish I had a larger tummy to accommodate all the delicious food. Udupi is proof that being vegan/vegetarian can be tasty and cruelty-free. Humble ambiance, no fancy decorations.

I got navratan korma, gobi Manchurian, aloo gobi, vegetable samosa, and vegetable biryani (rice). Oh my gosh, everything was so good! I found out this is southern Indian food, so they do it a little different and they don't have naan which is probably a good thing for limiting my carb intake. The navratan korma was so good although I am not 100% sure it's vegan; the friend I am with says it is. I looked up navratan korma, definitely made with ghee most the time dammit. Oh well. The vegetable biryani had a few chunks of ginger that I didn't care for. But overall love this place and I want to go back!
Love this place. Great selection of vegetarian items, all tasty, and buffet comes with two dosas sent to your table. I always leave here very stuffed.

Excellent Indian food restaurant with a mostly vegan menu and a few vegetarian options. 

The cauliflower is not to be missed and is a reason to dine here in itself. 

The decor and location could be better, but the high-quality lunch buffet makes this a perfect anytime choice for a  local Indian or vegetarian meal.

I'm literally writing this as I eat the Gobi Manchurian and I am so happy this restaurant exists. Vegans rejoice! All items are vegetarian and vegan items are clearly denoted so you don't have to ask questions. Indian cuisine wasn't my #1 favorite type of food, but this place has totally changed my mind.

There are so many delicious vegan options such as the Gobi, which reminds me of crispy chicken dishes you might find in a Chinese restaurant with the sauce-covered breaded cauliflower. Even if you eat meat, this is a total winner. It's spicy and super filling, one of my favorite restaurant items in the area. 

The vegetable biryani is another favorite of mine with great spices and depth of flavor. You really can't go wrong with any dish you order here. I can't wait to try more of the menu here and I'm lucky enough to live super close to this restaurant.
I loved the chettinad dosa- it was my first time that I had something in chettinad style. The chilly pakodas, thalis and cold coffee were also very good.

I've only been here for takeout a few times, but the staff is really friendly.  I've been looking for a place that makes good dosas and was so happy to find Udupi.  So happy they cater to vegetarians.  The Thiruneiveli Spinach Dosai is amazing!  I can't wait to try some other things!

This place is a savior on work days .Lunch buffet is a pretty good deal and the highlight of it is you will be served dosa's of your choice to your table. All you get is just vegetarian and typical south Indian touch in every item. I basically not a fan but sometimes it's OK when your crowd is vegetarians .

Coming to the ambience and the staff , you will not have a complaint . Recommended for a try.

Udupi is good.really good!  I only wish we had some thing similar here in PDX.  Most of the Indian buffets here mehh Udupi is all vegetarian/vegan. I never ordered off the menu, always buffet. 
Before Udupi this place was a Chinese restaurant. Cant recall but it was menu and at some point it changed ownership and became a chinese buffet. When it was chinese food menu/ and buffet it was average. One of those places you sort of forgot about until you happen to drive by.  Then one day we went there for Chinese food and it was closed. And i think that was late 2002 or some time in 2003. And at that time it was just abandoned. Udupi had yet to open.
Then some time in 2003 some friends invited me out to lunch. I didnt know where we were going they simply asked me if i liked Indian food. To my surprise we arrived at the location of the closed and abandoned chinese restaurant. And now it was an Indian restaurant. That frist time eating at Udupi was great.
I was hooked(lol) I made it one of my go to buffets....weekly. And usually on a Saturday or Sunday; Because they offer more items on the buffet during the weekend. Some thing ive seen in Las Vegas also. 
Udupi has changed over the years in the begining 2003 to about 2007 it was excellent. Their was always a change of food on the buffet. And it was delicious. Never boring. I dont know exactly when im guessing but at some point in 2007 or 2008 Udupi changed ownership. And then it went through another change of ownership a few years after the frist change. Udupi was never as good as it was in its frist 3 years.  Reason is, they stopped changing out the buffet offerings and if they did chamge them out it was never any thing exciting or out of the ordinary. It was still good and i still continued to eat there but, i was not as excited or looking forward to going to Udupi like in the early years. 
I now live far away and the last time i went to Udupi was probably in April 2015.  
And if i were living in Phoenix im sure i would be making a weekly stop over at Udupi for delicious lunch buffet.
So if your vegetarian/vegan and you find your self in Phoenix during lunch hour 
11-2.30. Head over to Udupi and fill up on some yummy south Indian food.

Although I am not a vegan/vegetarian, I really enjoyed Udupi cafe, having the sampler plate and appetizers including iddly.  It was definitely unlike any food I've ever had, with a stress on mixing varieties of different flavors and textures.  Hoping to make it to Southern India sometime in the next couple years and Udupi has given me another reason to look forward to it.
Fantastic vegan options, love this place. I love the Gobi and dosa. Service can be a bit slow, but the buffet at lunch is pretty decent!

We went for the first time today, for lunch, at Udupi in north Tempe, and it is now our favorite Indian restaurant in the vicinity. They have a daily lunch buffet with an impressive range of authentic dishes, wonderful breads, savory soups, and delicious desserts. 

All dishes are vegetarian, spiced just right, and highly satisfying. The best evidence of how good it is:  My wife and I both had several dishes from the buffet and filled our plates generously after a vigorous gym workout. By the time we finished eating, our plates looked like we had wiped them carefully with those amazing breads I mentioned! (But we didn't actually do that--this time.) :-) 

We live about a 7-minute drive from Udupi, and we'll be going back repeatedly in the future. You guessed right. We loved it!
smaller place - go for the buffet - all you can eat. I tried ordering off the menu and it was pricey and not that much food. I have returned several times. Good price - good food  ( buffet)

There are some good things here to eat.  The gobi manchurian is off the hook.  The Palak Paneer is really good.  However, there are some serious health code issues going on with this place.  Things are old, were cold when I get them and were buffet items from earlier in the day.  And there are cockroaches.  I had one in my food.  Unfortunately it was in the last thing I ate.........barf. The vegetables in my curry were obviously frozen from a bag.  Things taste microwaved.
Service here is kind of crap.  I saw another table get their food before us when we had ordered before them, and when we got our food things came out with 5 to 7 minutes between.  Its really awkward when I have to wait to eat and let my food get cold because were waiting for everyones food.
Although the food is good, I won't be coming back here.  I am afraid of getting food poisoning, and the roach left me thinking about what other nasty thing I could have eaten during my meal.

Not only was my dining experience deplorable, but it turns out so is this establishment's management. I recently learned from a disgruntled ex employee that our tips do not go to the servers. Instead they are told to lie to the customers and the restaurant keeps their tips. So, If for some reason you do eat there, make sure you give your server cash.

Wonderful, wonderful food - always the worst service. I generally think service reflects a bunch of factors (person, how busy it is, friendliness of the customer, etc), but they seem to overall never check on customers, they take time to provide service even when it's empty, and they don't make accommodations for spiciness of dishes.

My wife and I have been here three or four times during Lent, when we've been desperate for something tasty and vegetarian/vegan to eat. It's really hit the spot every time, so much so that it's a contender for our favorite Indian buffet in the Valley. They don't have the biggest spread, and the offerings have varied a bit each time we've been (I wish they'd give out a calendar listing Gobi Manchurian days in advance), but I've yet to try anything I don't like there.

Something I like about Udupi, but others might dislike, is that it's a little bit different every time. It's seemed to me like the spice level and flavor profiles have varied subtly each time I've eaten here - just enough to keep it interesting, and always within the bounds of "really good". 

As a meat-lover who's dabbled in vegetarianism and veganism, I've never thought, "I wish this meal had some meat," while eating at Udupi Café. And that's certainly enough to keep me coming back from time to time.

I will go back if I'm ever in town. I went here on Christmas. It was delicious. It is a vegetarian restaurant.

The service left much to be desired. I came here with a friend and would have felt like I was in a strange land without his help. I am not normally a fool in a restaurant, but I like when everything is explained to me when it's my first time. There was no clear waiter, and I amused myself by bugging everyone who passed by me for assistance. Ask and ye shall receive.

The food was delicious. The price was fine for a college student who would eat out once or twice a week. This place isn't too special as it is located adjacent to a laundromat. The ambiance is a little too unwelcoming for a date. Better for a lunch or dinner with friends.

If you want to drink housefly go here.
Yes it is true. I liked the onion dosa and the tamarind rice and this server refilled my glass of water and I was busy reading something and about half glass of water inside me, I saw a big housefly died and floating in the water. Man, the owner billed me and went to him and talked about housefly. He wasn't apologetic in the beginning and handed me a $5 coupon for next time. I told "sorry I don't think I will ever come again".

Every time we drive by Udupi Cafe, we think about stopping in & finally we got the chance to! We were really hoping for the buffet, but they only have that in the morning (11am-3pm daily).

After browsing the menu, we opted for the vegetable manchurian & the South Indian Thali. The Vegetable Manchurian was really tasty & was a very large portion (it was definitely priced well considering the quantity); the manchurian was a not very spicy, which I appreciated as I'm not a huge fan of spicy food (silly, I know, considering South Indian food is always really spicy). The South Indian Thali was very large as well & contained really spicy items ... It was also worth the money.

The service was good - it wasn't very busy on the week night that we went on & they had a new waitress - she asked us a couple of times if she could get anything out of the way when there was clearly still food remaining on all the plates - we didn't mind as she did note it was her first day. We'd definitely recommend this restaurant & will be back!

This place has a great lunch buffet! I ate there today, and every single dish I put on my plate was amazing! And very affordable price. The service is excellent as well. I walked in the restaurant looking bewildered trying to find my group and had 5 different people ask me within a few minutes if they could help me with anything and if I needed anything. Great overall experience.
The manager told me they don't have change for a 20. its a restaurant. That is such a lie. Just lazy and horrible service.

Udupi is one of those rare ethnic eateries in Tempe because it features the cusine of southern India, which is less represented in the Indian food available here in America. While most people would associate Indian food with lamb biryani and chicken tikka masala, Udupi's cuisine is a vegan person's ethnic paradise. I am definitely a fan of their Uthappam and just about anything on the menu that has potatoes in them. Any of their dosais are winners, but I do love the masala dosai a whole lot! Be adventurous and try a little of everything! This food gets mighty spicy though-- your taste buds will definitely be put to the test. Ample free parking and a great, friendly staff. My only gripe is that they're closed on Tuesdays.

I've given up trying to figure out which is my favorite, or even remembering the names of the dishes. I just go for the lunch buffet and take a little bit of everything and then fall into a deep food coma. Num Num Num Num mmmmmzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz......

This is the best Indian food I've had. My tastes are pretty basic, I'm not into risky food, and this stuff tasted great from the first bite!
Also, my wife and I judge authenticity of foreign food by the number of people from that country that eat there... you see lots of people from India eating here, with just their hands and all sometimes!

This review is purely for the buffet that's served today (02/21/2016). Based on my experience , I don't think I will ever return to this place!!

My dear non Indian friends-- The food served in this place is not even 1% representation of what authentic South Indian food is. 

Leave about the authenticity of the food (which can be toned down quite a bit to suit the local crowd) but any food that's has absolutely no SALT and served cold (when it's supposed to be served hot), is nothing but a joke. I don't mind paying extra $$ for good food but this is such a place who couldn't bother to either taste the food before getting it out or atleast made an attempt to keep it hot at the beginning of the lunch time.  

We returned home hungry after paying 36$ (including tips) -- a total waste. Please do yourself a favor and don't even attempt to taste the food -- even if it's given for free. I won't!!

On a positive side - the service staff was attentive and were trying their best to accommodate the customers. That's not enough for the worst food though.

Very ordinary food. We ordered the chili gobi which was sour, masala dosa which had no salt, veg biriyani which was awful. We also had the rose milk which was just terrible. Overall - avoid this place.

I have been here more than five times for Sunday brunch and have had fairly decent experiences. The buffet has a lot of options and some really good dishes like the bisibelebath. The dosas are better than anywhere else around here. However, it was a different experience today. I don't know if the food was bad because it was a weekday when they don't expect a lot of crowd. I am pretty sure I would not go back.

1. Rava dosa tasted extremely salty after it wasn't hot anymore and it drips oil!
2. Rasam did not taste like rasam. It was just mildly flavored water.
3. The raita served with Vegetable Biriyani was way too sour.
4. Vada was neither crispy on the outside nor soft on the inside. It was hard to fully eat even one. The chutney absolutely didn't taste fresh.

The Chaat Papri was the only saving grace.

Great food .. Amazingly soft and soaked sambar vada and really good ! The dosas were really good too. Been here 3 times in the last 10 days and I think I will be a visiting  again! Service is delayed but you can see they are learning the ropes... But overall really good Vegetarian food and is sure worth the trip !

My husband and I love Indian food, and Udupi has fast become a favorite. We've been for both the lunch buffet and regular dinner service.

The gobi manchurian gets mentioned quite a bit because it's awesome. Sadly, I haven't seen it at the lunch buffet yet, but it's a must order at dinner. The chole batura is another favorite Southern Indian dish, and Udupi's version is great. The puffy batura reminds me of a lighter version of fry bread, and the chickpeas are wonderfully spiced.

The lunch buffet is lots of fun. Delicious masala dosai are brought to the table, and they will even bring you a second helping. Not that there isn't tons more to choose from at the buffet. The Northern style curries like saag paneer and aloo gobi are pretty good, but the Southern dishes are better. We love getting the coconut studded rice here. So different than the basmati served at other Indian places. The sambar is really spicy, and I love dipping the pleasantly sour idli into it. I would skip the paratha though as it tastes more like a plain tortilla. We always finish up with dessert to put out the fire although we're usually bursting at the seams at that point. It's great when you can get stuffed with terrific food you couldn't possibly make at home for less than $10 per person.

We'll still stick with our long-time favorite, Nandini, for Northern dishes, but Udupi is top for Southern Indian.

My husband and I had dinner here last night and were greeted by the new owner with incredible hospitality. The menu is impressive - countless gluten-free vegan options! We had the rice crepe with potatoes, peppers, and Indian spices and it was amazing!

Super vegan friendly. My bf ordered this cauliflower dish that that was so crispy and delicious!! It almost tasted like real chicken! It had the same consistency. I loved my vegetable curry with rice. Any dish you order is guaranteed to have plenty if flavor and spices. I will be returning! So happy my friend told me about this spot!
Good variety on the menu. The food is good like usual Udupi restaurants, just that the portion size for dosa is too big and service was slow.

Fantastic

In the last few weeks since learning of this restaurant I have been twice. The first time we tried the Dosai and had to go back for it again.  The portions are large and the taste is absolutely delicious.  The staff is very accommodating.  I found a sauce that I enjoyed and asked for it again with a different dish, no problem.  This will be my go to for Indian food when in the area.  Don't let the looks and strip mall scare you off.  I read the reviews for our first visit, we were pretty hesitant to go in but found out it was well worth the visit.  I am not a vegetarian as everything on the menu is.   I still left full and happy.  Just writing this makes me want to go back.

Fantastic Vegetarian and Vegan Indian food!! I love the chili gobi, dosai, and okra dish. Service can be a bit slow, and I now a huge fan of the Sunday buffet. A huge chunk of it is Vegan, and almost anything on the menu can be made Vegan.

Recently my wife decided to become a vegetarian. We have been looking for new restaurants to eat at that would offer more options. I love Indian food and was delighted to find a vegetarian Indian food restaurant. I now have a NEW FAVORITE RESTAURANT!!! I can't wait to go back the food I had was delicious! Usually I like a chicken tikka masala BUT I found a better curry and without killing a chicken! Great place!!! Don't just read this review, GO!!

The lunch buffet is really good.  Several different chutneys, two kinds of soup, and peas ( i have no idea what the name of the dish is) that are fantastic.  I come here a lot as it is taste, inexpensive and uncrowded at lunch time.

While the interior is standard, the dishes are not what you find at at your typical Indian place. Completely vegetarian. Extensive menu with great prices. Try the spicy rasam soup and the malai kofta entree. Both were intensely flavorful. Host and servers were friendly at helpful.

I placed a togo order and got cheated. They gave me stale food in togo order  , I ordered masala dosa , medu vada and idli. Dosa was very hard while taking a bite, when chewing was like rubber it was pathetic. I will never ever visit Udipi Cafe again nor will i recommend anyone.
Solid dosas. They have good chilli gobi and manchurian. 4 stars just because their sambar is not that great.

This was our first time here and we really enjoyed the food. We had a table of 4 and we all tried each other's items. Everything was very tasty! The only downside was that the service was pretty slow. The restaurant wasn't crowded, but it took about 15 minutes to order, and we waited again for the check. The food came out quickly after we ordered, so that was nice, but we definitely had a couple, "did they forget about us?" moments

After settling for one or two vegetarian options on menus for years it's pretty overwhelming to select something from Udupi. Pages and pages of meat-free amazingness! My dinner companion and I ordered the palak paneer and dhal curries and both were SUPERB. I can't wait to go back and try more.

Unfortunately, this is another run of the mill Indian restaurant. We came for Sunday Buffett and we were disappointed by the lack of flavor in the foods. The sambar was missing salt and the dosa was stale. How can they mess up Southern Indian food which should be their specialty. And the music playing was just strange, and that's coming from a fellow Indian. Only upside was the staff was attentive and responsive.
So far in Phoenix area this is The place for Indian (south). Never been to one place so many time specially Indian . This place is worth every $.

All vegetarian which is so great. Mostly vegan too. Spicy in some dishes, but not so much that you can't stand it. 
Fresh papadams and roti. 
Fresh ice cream! 
Love this place.
Super handsome waiter with black hair and beard too, that's nice too :)
Nice art and very clean. 
30% off w/Groupon for first time there and 10% every time after.

My boyfriend and I went there today for lunch and it was AMAZING!!!!! I have been a vegetarian for almost 25 years and I can be a bit picky but not only was the food out of this world but the owner was extremely nice and welcoming to us.  There was a good mix of vegetarian and vegan options. The vegetable biryani was my personal favorite. The staff was nice and very detailed.  I am going to be a regular costumer from now on.  I live about 30 mins away but worth the drive.  To the owner I didn't get your name but you are doing a great job.  Thank you.

Another awesome vegan friendly place in Phoenix. All you can eat buffet on weekends is a real treat with over 10 vegan items. Also ordered take out and food came fast and was incredible. You get a lot for a good price which is rare these days.

First time...as good as I've tasted in the Indian Vegan food world.(admittingly not very versed) an order of the masala dosai great! gobi Manchurian was awesome!! Great spices. Great food. and they are just a POSTMATES call away! 

This would be a great 'compromise meal' if one finds themselves having to enjoy a vegan dinner...you won't miss the red meat/spices with these food options.

Udupi is one of the best Indian restaurants that I've ever been to (and I've been to a lot). The Gobi Manchurian (noted by several prior reviewers) and the Chole Peshwari are to die for. I also recommend their Sunday brunch even though it costs more than ordering off their menu. The only downside to Udupi is that it received some bad press for the cleanliness of their kitchen and dining room. I must admit that I saw a cockroach once at Udupi-- but, this was a year ago and they seem to have cleaned up their act. Nonetheless, the food is amazing, well priced, and offers a welcome treat to a veggie-lover's tummy!

The place is clean. Everything tastes nice. The price is decent. Been there 4 times now. 
Beverages like frappe and coffee are not good.
Very good lunch buffet. All vegetarian.

I found Udupi in the strangest way.   I was talking with my friend from NE Mesa, and she told me I was right next to her favorite Indian restaurant.  I thought it was ironic that I have been driving by it for a couple months and thought it was part of the laundry mat. Little did I know, it was a little piece of food heaven.   The atmosphere is less than desirable, but the food is fantastic!  The entire menu is vegetarian and I cannot recommend one thing, because it is all excellent. They do not serve alcohol, but you can bring your own bottle and they don't make you pay a cork fee.   I recommend going with a group, this allows you to order multiple items and try them family style.

Ok...first time I tried any kind of indian food, and I have to say it was just ok. It didn't really help that our server couldn't answer any questions about the menu. Ghe service was awful, we had to pretty much flag them down in order to place our order.
This place used to be better when the Indian family owned it, but it is still good offering authentic south Indian cuisine.
Pretty good South Indian food although just a bit overpriced when compared to other similar restaurants.  The Malai Kofta is so delicious!

Went there on Monday night around 9 P.M. They were accommodating even when they were about to close. Paper dosa was crispy and uthappam was tasty. Sambhar vada was nice too. Overall experience was good.

Great food , large portions. The Gobi Manchurian recommended by our server Judy was the best. Dosas and N Indian items that we ordered exceeded our expectations. Friendly service Nice ambience and spacious for business as well as large group entertainment. With Madras Ananda Bhavan to the North and Udupi to the South of the city, folks in Phoenix wanting authentic Indian Veg fare are well covered.

Food: I have never had food in my life with so much flavor! My mom and I had the 12$ sampler tray, Samosas, and this bread that was similar to Indian fry bread and it was outstanding. I do not think I have ever ate so much in my life. Keep in mind there is NO MEAT at this restaurant.

Service: The service was not all that great I must say, but since the food was so good I just had to give them a 5 star rating. The menu is extremely difficult to understand (and has no picture). If its your first time I highly recommend using the photos on yelp to assist you in ordering because the waitress was not very helpful. 

Location: The location is in a small strip mall and is nothing special. There is a good amount of seating and its generally nice and quite.
Love this place. Authentic taste of Indian food and savories. Would recommend if you go have the buffet in the afternoon. Masala dosa really good and crispy.

The food was OK.    Buffet style. 

What really left a bad taste in my mouth was
a.) Having my complete credit card number left on the receipt
b.) Getting hit with a $100 phone call charge to my credit card.  When I called my bank to investigate, it turns out somebody had charged a $100 phone call from London to INDIA on my credit card.  
c.) It turns out it was somebody from this restaurant.  

Stay away from this shady place.  There are plenty of other honest Indian food businesses in the metro Phoenix area.

I love cow and have to admit my knowledge of vegetarian and vegan foods is extremely limited. I was pretty skeptical of enjoying a meal here and thankfully happily surprised. I choose Indian food over Ethiopian any day of the week so Udupi was the choice to explore and also if you want northern Indian flavors. Located in a strip mall in South Scottsdale, it's not a place that stands out or calls to you.

Once you step inside, the food will do all the talking. Staff is sweet and knowledgeable if you aren't sure what to order. I came for dinner and my top choices are the mixed vegetable pakora, paper dosai, gobi manchurian and the vegetable briyani. Servings are ridiculously generous that you end up with leftovers for everyone. The dosa is lightly-fried bread (think of it as a crepe on steroids) that has the perfect crunch. The order comes with 3 sauces that are just lovely accompaniments for flavor. The pakora is equivalent to fried tempura and I love that they include jalapenos. My ultimate favorite is the briyani bursting with so much flavor. I took the leftovers home and added steak and sriracha to fill my big girl appetite. If you have room, finish off with a cup of chai and the madras special payasam (kheer). Rasmalai is another wonderful choice for dessert. How do you go wrong with homemade cottage cheese balls dipped in condensed milk and rose water?!!! 

Overall, it is inexpensive dining for good food. I would come back and try the lunch buffet, malasa, and paneer despite lacking the meat component. For a sliver of bites, I almost thought I could go vegeterian with these kinds of niblets. Then recalled they don't serve alcohol and my wanton carnivore ways came back to light.

Worst Indian food. Had been to lunch buffet. So vadas were very hard. Chutney was horrible. Idli was dry. Coming to main menu, shahi paneer was very sweet and aloo baingan overcooked. Their paratha was so hard and dry. Rice was dry and seemed like iy was the leftover from previous night. Coming to desserts ras malai was made from milk powder i guess. And gulab jamuns were not too good. Pista kulfi was nothing like a pista kulfi. There was this server who had a bad cold and was blowing up his nose in front of the guest and did not even bother to wash his hands. Very unhygienic. This was my first and last visit to this place. Had bad stomach upset after the buffet.Please guys dont waste your money.

I went to Udupi for dinner last night for the first time. We had about 8 people and the service was great. The food came out quickly and it tasted great!  The staff is super friendly and the selection of vegan dishes is amazing. This is going on my regular rotation of restaurants!

YUM!  The atmosphere is a bit of a downer (huge open space that's kinda blah) but the food makes up for it.  We went with the Cheese Dosai and the Mutter Paneer.  There is a whole Dosai section of the menu, so we figured we should try one, and the Cheese Dosai stood out to us because it has a lot of stuff in it, whereas many of the others just had chickpeas, onions, and/or potatoes.  I'd never had a dosai before and was surprised when it came out looking and tasting a lot like a quesadilla.  It was really good though and came with some tasty dipping sauces.   

The mutter paneer was delicious too with just the right amount of heat.  The portions were kinda huge.  I would love to come back sometime for the lunch buffet to sample just a little of everything.

Have been going here for years.... Seems it is back on track, & they are always very helpful and friendly... The masala dose, idly, & chutneys are all very good & authentic.  Gobi Manchurian is just like i've eaten in India... Lots of Indians go here & that is a good sign in my opinion!!!

I was in a rush, but wasn't in the mood for fast food.  Saw this place and decided to try it out.  I walked in and its a buffet setup, I asked if I can do a to-go and how much.  Man says yes and $10, I said sure set me up.  Hands me a styrofoam container, and I asked him I can put whatever I want, he said yes.   
Went to the line, and what a disappointment, the only thing that looked appetizing was vegetable biryani and idli.  So I put a little bit of rice and took 5 idlis...plates only half full.  I asked if they would bring out some more idli.  They said yes.  Shortly they brought out some more to restock the buffet.  I grabbed 5 more...now my plate is full.  And I am on my way right?

Wrong! the manager or owner stops me and says I'm sorry but I'm going to have to charge you extra for the idlis.  I'm baffled...he explains that buffet takeout is for a variety only and not just one thing.  I'm baffled...I ask him so if I dine in, and I take a plate of only one thing and maybe the second time I get the same thing you would charge me twice?  He says no, that's dine in though.  I'm baffled at the logic here...so I went along and says what are you going to charge me...he says $9...i'm baffled $19 for 1 plate of vegetarian food!  I can understand a premium steak but rice cakes (idlis)...unreal.  I was tempted to just leave the plate there and show him the bird, but I already commited to $10 already...and I was in a hurry and starving...so I bit the bullet and paid $9 more.

NEVER again will I give this place my business...and the food wasn't even that good...it's rice cakes for god sake.
Ok food and bad service. They have just three people taking care of the entire place which makes the service extremely slow. Definitely a bad first time experience.

This is so far the best Indian restaurant in the entire US. Living in Bay area for  4 years, with restaurants every nook and corner I feel this is so far the best South Indian restaurant. We were traveling back to the US of A from mexico and had a 16 hr layover in Phoenix. Decided to catch up on our Indian pallet :). We ordered a Udupi special thali and delux thali. Lot of food but there was not even a single dish we hated. The portions are huge, flavorful and homely style. The kanchipuram idly was yummy. The service was extremely nice. Recommend this restaurant to anyone in and around Phoenix/Tempe/ Scottsdale area.

This place has been talked about both good and bad for many years. Mainly the bad due to poor health scores. At last check they still don't even want to participate for a letter grade and seems to have a consistent stream of mildly concerning health issues. 

Being a veg place I figured, that even a few health issues can't kill me, at worst I would get some good quality time with a book so we gave it a try.

We started with the Gobi manchurian, It is listed under dishes but it works best as an appetizer. This dish is great and their execution worked quite well. We had a massive dosa which was great with the many dipping sauces. We also had a vegetable vindaloo that was forgettable. 

Over all the food was good and no one got sick. Prices are on part with any sit down indian place.  The ambiance is a bit odd

I have a South Indian food addiction.  I travel a lot and had previously sworn the only decent places to eat it are in Singapore and South India.  But I am really impressed with the quality and flavors here. Everything was really fresh, the chutneys & sambar flavorful, and of all things, the masala chai was off the hook.  Everything is pure veg, so you know the chefs are legit and it shows.   I used to be "meh" on Phoenix but now I can't wait to come back just to eat here again.
My rating is harsh because the variety of food is always disappointing, the food is good and  dosas are much better than dosas at chutneys, but their buffet options are boring.

Very good vegetarian dishes with just enough spices.  One of the better Indian food buffets I've had.  

My little cutie pie loved the papadums, poori and naan dipped in cucumber yogurt.   The Paper Masala Dosai was so addicting it added another size to my feet at the end of the day.   The crazy thing about vegetarian is the carb and sodium overload.  When I make vegetarian dishes at home I balance it out with Omega 3 good fats such as coconut, avocado, nuts and olive oil.  So all the curries, chutneys and puvlavs went directly to my bloodstream!  I'd go again, however, I wished they served a side of chicken.

This was a wonderful place for namma udupi cuisine. Really friendly service, great Mysore Maharaja thali. 
It helped that we were eating after a long hike! :D

udupi cafe -smells good as soon as you walk in! HANGRY GOOD! I enjoyed the whole buffet until I could no longer get out of my seat. jk÷)
The guys there are super friendly and kind, i like people and food so 5 stars.keep it up! and over 12yrs at that location. They might know a thing or 2.

FOOD HAS GONE DOWN HILL IN QUALITY A BIT.  THE OWNER IS UNFRIENDLY-treats you like a burden than a paying customer.  Guess he doesn't need the business.  I wont be cack anymore, especially with so many other better Indian restaurants around.

I had a literally explosively bad experience with an indian restaurant a while back and it ruined me for all indian food ever since.  It's been 10 years since that happened and every time someone drags me to an Indian restaurant the smell makes me queasy and it's hard for me to stomach the food.  A friend brought me out to Udupi and sitting at the table with folded arms I started to try the food and thought to myself this is the best food I've had in a long time!  I loved the unique flavors and the big elephant ear looking thing was amazing.  I couldn't pronounce anything on the menu but everything my friend ordered was so good.  Udupi's amazing food brought me back to liking indian food again and I didn't even mind it was vegetarian.

Food was delicious and sambhar was just too good. Highly recommend this place.
 We order Masala Dosa, veg Cutles, Idly and mesh vada with sambhar

Good variety but food was generally too spicy. Appreciated that it was vegan. Wait staff helpful. Took a plate of food but it was too spicy for my taste. Was the same experience with two other customers with me.Always happy when Indian food is lightly spiced and we can add more spice if we choose. Would not go back.

I love reading others reviews about my favorite restaurants. Regardless of the nasty health reports which have since been taken care of,  this is the best southern Indian food  have ever had. The lunch buffet is always good. There is this cauliflower dish on the menu that is so friggin good, I wish I could remember the name. Everything I have put in my mouth here as been worth telling about. If you don't need meat at every meal like most Americans think they do then try it. I love it when I go into any ethnic restaurant and see more people of that particular ethnicity than your run of the mill American. To me it is a good sign of an authentic food experience.

Amazing. First, we were greeted by a very nice girl (hostess) and got seated. Then our waitress had all the answers to the questions we had. And then there was.... food! It exceeded my expectations. I know that being vegan is a bit annoying not only to me, by to those around me and this restaurant was perfect for me and my non-vegan husband. :). Highly recommend.

Delicious vegetarian fare!  Friends brought us curry takeout from here and we loved it so much that we went over for lunch.  They have a buffet full of so many wonderful choices - tons of variety and flavor, not so heavy as to make you feel like you've over-indulged and not so light as to feel inauthentic and americanized.  This is a great deal for the price and the service is quite pleasant, too.  Looking forward to our next visit.

I went on a Wednesay with a collegue visitng from India that was craving hojmetown food.  Little selection and way to salty.  Some dishes were tasy and I appreciate the all-veginess, but was dissapointed.
Really superb. We tried the mulagatawny soup, veggie pakora, aloo gobi, dosai masala, and the veggie lentil pancake, and everything was fantastic.

The food is light and tasty! 

I usually prefer the buffet as we get to eat all the delicacies from starters to desserts. The desserts are amazingly nice here and the manchuria is awesome. 
However the paratha (pita) here is extremely hard and difficult to eat. 
The idly vada n sambar combination is an ever green combo and it's perfect here. 

Over all a good place to start with for indian food. Value for the buck

Great food.
Dosa's are especially great. Authentic South Indian cuisine that brought me back to my childhood days in India. The crispness of the Dosa was sensational in my mouth as I devoured this fantastic Dosa. The vada was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. It was a melt in your mouth. The idols were as soft as a baby wipe. It was spongy soft and it dissolved in your mouth.

I have lived near this place for about 11 years and only recently have I made it in for a visit.... Such good food, I have been missing out!!  After reading the menu for entirely too long, I went with the vegan vindaloo.  So good!  Spicy for sure ... True testament to how my taste buds have changed and adapted these years living in Arizona.  I don't think my previous midwest palate would have handled that spice. ;-)  
This is a great spot for vegetarians, as everything on the menu is meat-free.  Many dishes can also be made vegan, yay!  I loved the vindaloo... All the veggies and potatoes with that fluffy jasmine rice.  I had enough food for two more meals!   I also had a cup of the rasam soup, which is described as hot and sour.  I really liked it.  It was light and brothy with veggies, definitely tangy and good spice.  Prices are fair, food is good, service is prompt.

This Indian restaurant has had a severe problem with cockroaches and other health issues in the past. I was a frequent customer until discovering this unpleasant fact. When I tried to report it here on Yelp, the restaurant complained to Yelp headquarters and had my review removed. 

I will never set foot in here again.

It's hard to find quality vegetarian restaurants in the Valley (let alone all-vegetarian eateries at all.) So thank gosh for Udupi Café, a tasty Tempe spot that just so happens to be less than a mile away from the all-vegan Green.

Udupi serves a wide variety of Indian food that, unless you're familiar with the type of cuisine, will require some translation help when ordering.

Be warned: the portions here are huge, which rocks, considering the dirt cheap prices.

I got the Sambar Vada, which are fried lentil donuts you can dip in a spicy sauce. I also got Paneer Pakora, fried cheese, and Poori, big, fluffy bread.
